title: Patriots WR Kayshon Boutte details battle with gambling addiction
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "I gambled until I was completely broke.
When it was all said and done, I put in around $90,000 of my own money, and lost it all.
" Kayshon Boutte emerged as Drake Maye's go-to deep threat this season.

title: Springfield man charged with murder, allegedly hit his neighbor with his car repeatedly
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime The victim’s wife reportedly told police that the suspect allegedly hit her with his car before the incident that left her husband dead.
A Springfield man is facing a murder charge after he allegedly struck his neighbor several times with his car.

Joseph Vaughan, 68, of Springfield, was arraigned Monday in Springfield District Court and charged with murder and assault and battery with a dangerous weapon, the Hampden District Attorney’s Office said in a statement.

title: Stefon Diggs’ explains Patriots’ new rallying cry: ‘No new macaroni’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "You didn't have a mindset that you wanted to win last week?
Or the week before that?
Or throughout the season?

title: Fenway concession workers ratify new contract after a year of negotiations that included a strike
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News "For me, this is also about respect," Austin Petruzziello, a Fenway worker, said in a press release.
Carlos Aramayo, president of Local 26 UNITE HERE, speaks at a press event about contract negotiations for Fenway Park workers.
David L Ryan/The Boston Globe Fenway Park workers ratified a new contract with the historic ballpark that includes wage increases, improved gratuities, and added ID checkers, their union said.

title: Patriots’ Will Campbell is hoping for a freezing Gillette Stadium with Chargers coming to town
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "I enjoy playing up here.
I enjoy being a part of this team and playing with these guys.
" Will Campbell is used to the chilly conditions in New England.

title: Uxbridge police officer killed by tractor-trailer while on duty, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News The Uxbridge police officer leaves behind a wife and child, the DA said.
Black bunting is draped across the Uxbridge Police Department entry after an officer was killed in a motor vehicle crash Wednesday.
Emily Sweeney/The Boston Globe An Uxbridge police officer was struck and killed by a tractor-trailer in the early hours of Wednesday while responding to a multi-vehicle crash, officials said.

title: Is it important for front and rear tires to match?
author: John Paul
bullets: How To John Paul, AAA Northeast's Car Doctor, hears from a reader who got a surprise after ordering new tires.

title: Patriots dealing with illness spreading in locker room ahead of Chargers playoff game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Three players on New England's offensive line missed practice on Wednesday due to illness.
Morgan Moses missed Wednesday's practice due to illness.

title: Firefighters rescued a ‘silly goose’ after she fell through the ice on Cape Cod
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The 4-year-old golden retriever was stranded about 200 feet out from the shore of Goose Pond in Chatham, fire officials said.
Chatham fire officials rescued a 4-year-old golden retriever after she fell through the ice on Goose Pond.
Chatham Fire Department A silly goose had to be rescued after she fell through the ice at the fittingly-named Goose Pond.
